newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Ballast sees U.K. unit in black this year.
newsitem.headline: Ballast sees U.K. unit in black this year.

text.p: Dutch builder Ballast Nedam said on Friday its U.K. construction activities posted a small loss in 1996 but were expected to return to the black in the current year.
"Ballast Wiltshier posted a loss of several million guilders in 1996, but we hope to come out of the red in 1997," Ballast chairman Werner Ludwig told a results news conference.

Ballast Wiltshier, formed through the takeover of British builder Wiltshier Plc at end-1995 and its subsequent merger with Ballast's existing U.K. activities, accounted for some 50 percent of group turnover growth last year, Ludwig said.
Ballast Nedam on Thursday reported full-year 1996 net profits dipped to 91.5 million guilders from a year-earlier 92.1 million, reflecting an increased tax bill.
Turnover jumped 26 percent to 3.8 billion guilders.
Ludwig said Ballast Wiltshier, one of Britain's top ten general building companies in terms of turnover, stood to benefit from an expected upturn in the U.K. construction market.
The U.K. market was seen growing by up to five percent over the coming years, he said.
Ballast Nedam is 48 percent by Hochtief AG of Germany.
